title: Retired Military
description: Retired Military
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

groups.name: The Citadel Military College of South Carolina

title: Joint Planner
description: Joint – Interagency planner for Joint Force Headquarters-National Capital Region conducting planning and coordination for homeland defense and civil support operations in the National Capital Region Joint operations area. Coordinated with planners in the Office of the Secretary of Defense, the Joint Staff, U.S. Northern Command, and multiple local, State, District, and Federal agencies supporting National Special Security Events (NSSEs) and other civil support activities. Served as the Chief of the Joint Planning Group to conduct operational mission analysis, the preparation of plans and orders, and integration of joint-interagency operations in the National Capital Region. Appointed as Liaison Officer to Arlington National Cemetery.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

groups.name: The Citadel Military College of South Carolina

headquarters:
200 Stovall St.

Alexandria,
VA
22332
United States
address: 200 Stovall St.  Alexandria, VA 22332 United States

title: Operations Officer
description: Operations Officer for the Army Forces component to Joint Task Force Bravo. In charge of providing command and control, communications, and synchronized training and mission planning for task organized force packages in support of Joint Task Force Bravo and Southern Command priorities in Central America to include, rapid response humanitarian and disaster relief efforts and theater security cooperation activities. Planned, organized, and executed operations in support of joint, combined, and interagency operations throughout Central America for Joint Task Force Bravo. Managed synchronizing, planning, and resourcing all Army force training. Supervised and conducted military decision making processes and problem solving in conjunction with Army Forces and Joint Task Force missions. Responsible for mission readiness, training management, and composite risk management for Army Forces. Conducted Antiterrorism/Force Protection planning and training within the Joint Task Force and for the Army Forces. Coordinated all host nation support for security in support of operations. Made vulnerability assessments for several missions in various locations throughout Central America. Provided recommendations for mitigation, increasing the safety of Joint Task Force personnel during operations. Assisted in the planning and implementation for counter narcotics missions and operations within Honduras.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

groups.name: The Citadel Military College of South Carolina

headquarters:
200 Stovall St.

Alexandria,
VA
22332
United States
address: 200 Stovall St.  Alexandria, VA 22332 United States

title: J3 Executive Officer
description: Executive Officer for the J3 Operations Directorate of a Department of Defense joint organization of over 100 military, federal employees, and civilian contractors. Responsible for assigning, managing, and monitoring all taskings within the directorate received from both internal and external sources. Assisted in the coordination of the J3 divisions with regard to missions, duties, projects, and priorities. Coordinated logistical requirements from external agencies to support missions. Managed the Defense Travel System within the Directorate as an approving authority for all official travel. Supported and supervised awards submissions, evaluations, reporting, and correspondence. Supervised security as the security manager for the J3 administrative section. The content manager of the J3 portal page. Managed and coordinated Department of the Army, Joint and federal interagency, state and local interagency actions, taskings, briefings, meetings, special events and executed special projects. Performed and managed a wide variety of administrative, logistical, personnel management, document control, and automation and integration activities for the Operations Directorate.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

groups.name: The Citadel Military College of South Carolina

headquarters:
200 Stovall St.

Alexandria,
VA
22332
United States
address: 200 Stovall St.  Alexandria, VA 22332 United States

title: JOC Director
description: Director of Joint Operations Center for a joint organization of over 5,000 military, federal employees, and civilian contractors that provided continuous situational awareness in the national capital region to facilitate decision making by the staff and commander. Planned, organized and directed the daily activities of the operations center and supervised 50 personnel with equipment valued at over $3 million dollars. Provided leadership ensuring efficient and effective operation in support of day to day operations and activities to include rotating shifts under increased manning for emergency operations. Exercised personnel management responsibilities and oversight of contractor personnel to include validation of deliverables. Planned, coordinated and maintained liaison with federal, state, local and Department of Defense agencies to ensure operational, law enforcement, force protection, and security support to the White House, Department of Defense, Department of the Army, and Joint Force Headquarters-National Capital Region and U.S. Military District of Washington for contingency missions, ceremonies and special events. Prepared and gave over fifty complex briefings to senior leadership on operations, security and force protection issues.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

title: CJ3 Current Operations
description: In charge of synchronizing the operations of approximately 45 functional sections staffing the headquarters Combined Joint Operations Center in support of combat operations, reconstruction and development, and governance operations throughout Afghanistan. Supported five geographically dispersed Regional Commands consisting of approximately 40,000 military personnel from over three dozen countries. Coordinated response to major incidents and In-extremis support in accordance with North Atlantic Treaty Organization, International Security and Assistance Force, individual national rules of engagement, standing operating procedures, and national caveats. Screened all incidents and actions to ensure timely notification of International Security and Assistance Force Command group of any events meeting Commander’s Critical Information requirements criteria. Coordinated with the Air Coordination Element for all theater requests for close air support and supported dynamic targeting efforts of high value targets.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

title: Deputy Chief of Training
description: Provided training support to over 65,000 Soldiers in US Army Europe. Directed over 330 people with a $12 million budget in 23 locations throughout Germany, Italy, Belgium, Netherlands, Bosnia, and Kosovo. Acted as the Chief of Staff for the organization to ensure all administrative operations are integrated and synchronized with higher headquarters. Provided oversight for US Army Europe’s Regional Training Support Centers, range modernization, and integrated training lands program, training aids devices and simulators program, visual information, organizational inspection program, and training support to deployed forces.
name: Stephen (Steve) Mandes

title: G3 Plans and Operations Officer/Advisor
description: Advisor to the Plans and Operations Division, National Headquarters of the Saudi Arabian National Guard. A National level staff responsible for planning, coordinating, synchronizing, and providing training support to 9 combat brigades, 10 separate battalions, totaling 105,000 Soldiers. Provided advice and assistance to Saudi primary staff officers concerning decision making, formal planning, training, establishing priorities, allocating resources, standing operating procedures development, and the coordination of operational level plans and orders with National Agencies. Also in charge of the operations, maintenance, and modernization of the Kingdom wide multimillion dollar live fire complexes and ranges.

title: US Army TRADOC G-2 ISR TOPOFF Instructor/Site Lead/A-O/T
description: I work for US Army TRADOC G-2 as a contractor as an ISR Instructor and Subject Matter Expert (SME) to support training of BDE/RCT level units on non-organic ISR capabilities, products and processes as part of the ISR TOPOFF MTT, which includes the following duties: - instruction on new Army related ISR capabilities, products and processes. - Coordinates with Service and DoD Intelligence Community organizations, and operational and tactical units to gain access to current and future ISR/RSTA products and tactics, techniques, and procedures (TTP). - Maintains familiarity with Army ISR portals and applications, product reports, and product dissemination architectures, especially regarding how to employ ISR products and support mission analysis at BDE/RCT level. - Develops, updates and maintains classified and releasable courseware to support instruction on ISR/RSTA capabilities, especially Army sensors and products. - Updates ISR Capabilities module Program of Instruction (POI). - Researches current ISR/RSTA capabilities, products, gaps, and lessons learned. - Maintain currency on fielded Army ISR sensors, platforms and products, as well as future systems.
name: Jeffrey Sargent

address: BAE Systems 6 Carlton Gardens London,  SW1Y 5AD United Kingdom

title: Joint Special Operations Intelligence Analyst/Trainer
description: Assists in planning, designing, executing, controlling & analyzing joint SOF training & exercises. Supports contingency operations as required. Attends & facilitates conferences, Develops observation & training plans. Collects, analyzes, and reports lessons learned. Serves as an Analyst/Trainer during joint exercises. Leads the analysis & preparation of after action reviews & reports. Leads the review & recommendation of changes to joint SOF doctrine. Leads the development & presentation of SOF related training seminars. Coordinates & interfaces with the JWFC & theater SOC exercise planners. Prepared and present daily situational briefings and reports in order to keep senior leadership abreast of training status. Mentors and trains commanders and staffs of geographic Combatant Commands (GCC's), Joint Task Forces (JTF's), & Joint Special Operations Task Forces (JSOTF's). Assists in designing exercises, developing scenarios, & master scenario events lists (MSELs) Accomplishments: * Conducted a detailed review of the SOCJFCOM Intelligence Handbook. * Deployed with a 15 person SOCJFCOM Joint Training Team to Chile in support of Special Operations Command Southern Command (SOCSOUTH) to serve as an Intelligence A/T during Exercise SOUTHERN STAR 09. Provided analysis, training and a detailed lessons learned package for a Combined Joint Special Operations Task Force (CJSOTF) Building Partner Capacity (BPC) exercise. Personally responsible for coordinating and producing a 60+ page report built on the observations of the JTT. * Developed a tool, lauded as groundbreaking, setting the standard for use by the entire SOCJFCOM Joint Training Team in organizing and streamlining the process of organizing and writing observation reports on joint special operations staffs.
name: Jeffrey Sargent

title: Joint Exercise Intelligence Planner
description: Position: Lead Exercise Intelligence Planner: Sep 2006 – June 2009 United States Joint Forces Command / Joint Transformation Command-Intelligence / Joint Warfighting Center, Suffolk, Virginia (US Army Major, O4) Duty Description: • Plans, executes, and provides intelligence support to joint and combined Mission Rehearsal Exercises (MRX's). Augments and assists theater combatant commanders and service chiefs in their preparation for joint and combined intelligence operations during joint exercises. Represents the command at joint and combined exercise planning conferences. Coordinates theater, national, service and multinational intelligence participation and augmentation to support joint and combined exercises. Assists the training audience in development of intelligence C4I architectures for joint and combined exercises. Manages the intelligence portion of scenario and scripting development for joint and combined exercises. Deploys to exercises and serves as senior functional intelligence controller/liaison in the Joint Exercise Control Group (JECG) during joint and combined exercise execution.
name: Jeffrey Sargent

title: Commander B Co 501st MI Battalion
description: * Served as commander of a tactical Intelligence company supporting 2nd Brigade Combat Team during combat operations in Iraq. * Provided daily classified intelligence products to facilitate Brigade and Battalion Commanders' decision making process. * Responsible and personally involved in all operational, administrative, logistical, personnel security, and organizational systems in the unit. * Personally developed and led the unit Family Readiness Group, supporting both single and married Soldiers and their families in the unit. * Stood up the first Shadow Tactical Unmanned Aerial Vehicle (TUAV) Platoon in Germany, successfully flying the first ever Shadow TUAV flights at Hohenfels Training Area, Germany * Implemented a TUAV flight safety program, resulting in zero incidents of accident, damage or loss to personnel and equipment while conducting continuous combat missions in Ramadi, Iraq. * Maintained over 95% medical readiness rate for all Soldiers in my command. * Briefed the Commanding General numerous times on my quarterly training plan, which included all tactical and Intelligence training events my company conducted. * Directly accountable for over 20 million dollars of highly sensitive and classified equipment; maintained 100% accountability with no incidence of property loss in over 19 months of command. * Maintained equipment maintenance operational readiness rates of over 95% throughout my command.
name: Jeffrey Sargent

title: Division Artillery Senior Intelligence Officer
description: Served as senior Intelligence officer on Baghdad International Airport (BIAP), responsible the local personnel vetting program and local national weapons possession authorization. * Provided Base security Intelligence support to all BIAP tenant units. * Served as the senior intelligence officer as DIVARTY took on a BCT Role and assumed responsibility of the entire portion of Baghdad south of Route Irish (Al Rasheed). This was arguably the largest BCT AO in terms of both population and square kilometers. * Responsible for CI/HUMINT Collection operation responsible for Deliberate and Time Sensitive Targeting of Division and BCT HVI/HVT's. Led the BCT's targeting efforts during multiple named division operations, including Iron Hammer and Iron Justice. * Led Intelligence support to the BCT Targeting process - Conducted weekly Intelligence updates to the Brigade Targeting Cell (or FECC). * Collected, Analyzed, Produced and Disseminated All Source Intelligence, focusing on real-time CI/HUMINT Operations dedicated to capture or killing Anti Coalition Force networks conducting wide scale IED attacks on Route Irish and the Southern Baghdad along the Division Task Force boundary. * Provided continuous tactical intelligence support for 12 months to three battalions conducting combat operations in the largest, and arguably the most volatile, district in Baghdad. * Supported 1st Armored Division counter fire artillery missions through real time analysis of satellite imagery on ADOCS, AFATADS, C2PC and Falcon View in order to determine collateral damage effects to populated areas. * Brigade Anti Terrorism Force Protection (AT/FP) Officer, responsible for ensuring DIVARTY complied with all applicable AT/FP requirements. * Brigade representative to the installation AT/FP Working Group. * Served as Brigade Action Officer for the preparation and execution of a CFE Inspection by Former USSR countries in conjunction with the Defense Threat Reduction Agency (DTRA)
name: Jeffrey Sargent

title: Joint Plans Officer
description: * Action Officer on numerous projects * Secretary of Defense Contingency Planning Guidance (CPG) staffing and review. (The SECDEF CPG is a concise, classified document the secretary uses to inform the Chairman, Joint Chiefs of Staff, of general and specific strategic areas of concern to the civilian leadership for which contingency planning should be conducted. * Chief, Joint Chiefs of Staff (CJCS) Joint Strategic Capabilities Plan (JSCP) staffing and review. The JSCP carries out the CJCS's National Military Strategy and National Objectives by directing Theater Combatant Commanders to accomplish strategic planning. * EUCOM 4000 Series deliberate plans (CONPLAN's, FUNCPLAN's, and CENTCOM OPLAN Support) * EUCOM Global War on Terrorism (GWOT) Campaign Plan
